column2: HAWAII PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Distractions that take your attention away from driving can be caused by ______ while driving.
2. ________ is the only effective way to reduce your Blood Alcohol Content (BAC).
3. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 4. The effects of alcohol on driving do NOT include:
5. This road sign means:
6. This sign indicates:
7. This signal means:
8. This road sign means:
column6: Trucks have the right of way

column2: 9. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column6: you may stop to let out passengers.
column8: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column10: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.

column2: 10. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column6: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 11. A red traffic sign means?
12. When a driver has their left arm and hand extended upward, the driver plans to:
13. If traffic on the other side of an intersection is backed up and you cannot get completely through, you must:
column4: enter the intersection and try to avoid blocking it.
column6: wait until traffic ahead is clear.
column8: turn right instead of going straight through the intersection.
column10: enter the intersection and proceed with caution.

column2: 14. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
15. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column6: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column8: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 16. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
17. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 18. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.
column8: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
20. If you are angry, you should ________ before driving.
column4: take a few minutes to cool off

column2: 21. In a heavy rain, tires can ride on a thin film of water, without touching the road. This is called:
22. A flashing yellow light:
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.
column8: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.

column2: 23. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
24. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column6: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.

column2: 25. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column8: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.

27. ___________ are the most frequent fatality in work zone crashes.

29. A yellow arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: is never used as a traffic signal.
column6: is warning the traffic a green arrow is about to be shown.
column8: means the same as a circular yellow light for the lane of traffic indicated by the arrow.
column10: means that you may go in the direction indicated by the arrow.

column2: 30. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is about to stop.
column6: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column10: You must pass the school bus.
